item.title: GB's Dean takes stunning gold in swimming
item.description: Tom Dean claims a stunning gold and Duncan Scott silver to ensure a British one-two finish in a thrilling 200m freestyle at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Boris Johnson pledges to target drug abuse in anti-crime push
item.description: More local officers and tagging of ex-prisoners are also promised, but police demand extra funding.

item.title: Mum hit by car at Denbighshire festival as daughter, 2, thrown to safety
item.description: "I genuinely believed my whole family had died", says Jenna O'Neill, who suffered serious injuries.

item.title: Covid-19: Olympic champion's coronavirus comeback and more tests for 'pinged' workers
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday morning.

item.title: Covid: More pinged workers eligible for daily tests instead of isolation
item.description: Waste workers, prison staff and defence workers will be able to avoid isolation, the government says.

item.title: Miami tower collapse: Final victim identified from rubble
item.description: The family of Estelle Hedaya say they have confirmation she is the 98th victim of the Surfside disaster.

item.title: Bezos' $2bn offer to get back in race to the Moon
item.description: The billionaire offers to pay $2bn in Nasa costs to be reconsidered for a key Moon lander contract.

item.title: US combat forces to leave Iraq by end of year
item.description: The move, while largely symbolic, could provide a domestic boost to both the US and Iraqi leaders.

item.title: Australia's vaccine rollout colossal failure - ex-PM
item.description: Ex-PM Malcolm Turnbull tells the BBC he believes Australia's borders won't reopen until early 2022.

item.title: House prices at new high as buyers seek more space
item.description: Strong demand for houses will last into 2022 as buyers react to the pandemic, says property website Zoopla.

item.title: North and South Korea restore hotline after a year
item.description: The two countries have not spoke since Pyongyang cut off all channels of communication last year.

item.title: The Papers: 'Pure gold' at Olympics and tags for burglars plan
item.description: The papers cover the UK's gold medals in Tokyo and government plans for a "crackdown" on crime.

item.title: Brazil: Why are so many pregnant women dying from Covid?
item.description: One in five women that died from coronavirus in Brazil didn't have access to an intensive care unit.

item.title: Parkour athlete: 'She wants to be a doctor so she can fix me'
item.description: Luke Callinan, 35, has been diagnosed with a rare form of multiple sclerosis.

item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: Hemingway 'lookalike' chosen in Florida contest
item.description: A 63-year-old won the Key West, Florida contest for his likeness to the award-winning author.

item.title: German lawyers wrangle over pensioner's WW2 tank in basement
item.description: The 84-year-old kept the vehicle in his basement, along with an anti-aircraft gun and a torpedo.

item.title: Standon Calling festival-goers make most of mud as heavy rain hits
item.description: Organisers of the festival call it off due to flooding and risk of lightning.

item.title: London flooding: When a month of rain fell in one day
item.description: From blocked roads to flooded homes, the deluge of rain has caused huge disruption to the capital.

item.title: Deadly street protests over Iran water shortages
item.description: Khuzestan is one of the country's hottest regions, where temperatures can reach 50C.

item.title: The new surgical tool inspired by a wasp
item.description: The device avoids clogging by using friction instead of suction, similar to the way a parasitoid wasp lays its eggs.

item.title: The repair shop trying to fix throwaway culture
item.description: A social enterprise has opened up shop in Glasgow to encourage communities to repair and reuse their possessions.

item.title: The repair team preserving an 18th Century home
item.description: Meet the people who work to keep Dennis Severs' 18th Century house in Spitalfields open.

item.title: The Making of Tom Daley
item.description: Olympian Tom Daley looks back at the moments that have shaped his life and career.

item.title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

item.title: Stealthing: 'I didn't realise it's rape until it happened to me'
item.description: Two women share their experiences of non-consensual condom removal during sex.

item.title: John Stonehouse: Bizarre tale of the MP who faked his own death
item.description: Was John Stonehouse a spy who betrayed his country? Or a naive and broken man? James Naughtie investigates.

item.title: Kenyans sue the British army over fire at wildlife sanctuary
item.description: Some 1,000 people are going to court after a fire destroyed 12,000 acres of land at a wildlife sanctuary.

item.title: Extreme weather: What causes flash flooding?
item.description: Cities across the world are at risk of extreme rainfall overwhelming their streets

item.title: Can better tech make video meetings less excruciating?
item.description: Technology firms are scrambling to add new features but will video calls improve.

item.title: How Amy Winehouse's legacy is helping women in addiction recovery
item.description: Amy's Place provides safe housing for women when they leave rehab to help them live independently.

item.title: COP 26: How much is the developing world getting to fight climate change?
item.description: Are rich countries living up to their climate promises to the developing world?

item.title: Could Covid vaccine be taken as a pill?
item.description: Researchers are looking at easier ways for people to get the vaccine, including via inhalers and tablets.

item.title: Walkden suffers last-gasp semi-final taekwondo defeat
item.description: Great Britain's Bianca Walkden suffers a last-gasp defeat by South Korea's Lee Da-bin in the Olympic taekwondo +67kg semi-final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Dean, Duncan Scott, Georgia Taylor-Brown and surfing feature in early day four highlights
item.description: Watch some of the best moments from the early events of day four at the Tokyo Olympics including a gold and silver for Team GB in the pool.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Tom Dean wins gold with Duncan Scott clinching silver for GB in men's 200m freestyle
item.description: Watch as Team GB's Tom Dean wins 200m freestyle gold with team-mate Duncan Scott clinching silver at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Georgia Taylor-Brown wins triathlon silver as Flora Duffy wins gold
item.description: Team GB's Georgia Taylor-Brown wins triathlon silver despite suffering a puncture, as Flora Duffy wins Bermuda's first ever Olympic gold medal at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain men's hockey team suffer first loss with 5-1 defeat by Germany
item.description: Great Britain's men's hockey team suffer their first defeat of the Tokyo Olympics with a 5-1 loss to Germany in Pool B.

item.title: Murray and Salisbury reach doubles quarter-finals
item.description: Andy Murray continues his bid for a fourth Olympic medal as he and Joe Salisbury reach the men's doubles quarter-finals in Tokyo.

item.title: England players to hold talks over men's Ashes tour as some consider pulling out
item.description: England men's players will meet with the ECB as some consider pulling out of this winter's Ashes if their families are not allowed to travel to Australia.

item.title: Tom Dean: Swimmer's family and friends celebrate his 200m freestyle gold
item.description: Watch what happened when Team GB swimmer Tom Dean's family and friends gathered in his mum's garden to watch him in the 200m freestyle final at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Naomi Osaka loses to Marketa Vondrousova in women's singles tennis
item.description: Japanese superstar Naomi Osaka suffers a surprise exit in her home Olympics as Czech Marketa Vondrousova earns a straight-set win.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Georgia Taylor-Brown wins silver in women's triathlon
item.description: Great Britain's Georgia Taylor-Brown fights back from a bike puncture to earn an Olympic silver medal in the women's triathlon.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Dean takes gold, plus silvers for Duncan Scott and Georgia Taylor-Brown
item.description: Tom Dean takes gold ahead of compatriot Duncan Scott, while Georgia Taylor-Brown wins triathlon silver as Great Britain's strong start to the Tokyo Games continues.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Surfers Italo Ferreira & Hiroto Ohhara ride big waves
item.description: Watch Italo Ferreira and Hiroto Ohhara ride big waves as a tropical storm hits the Tsurigasaki surfing beach during the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tom Daley: The boy with the Olympic dream that came true
item.description: The 'baby' of Beijing became a father, a husband and an LGBTQ+ spokesperson. And now Tom Daley is an Olympic gold medallist. This is his story.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty becomes two-time Olympic champion - immortality next?
item.description: Adam Peaty won 100m breaststroke gold on Monday to become a double Olympic champion - and there's plenty more to come from the Briton.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty, Tom Daley & Matty Lee and Tom Pidcock win gold for GB on 'Magic Monday'
item.description: Adam Peaty, Tom Daley & Matty Lee and Tom Pidcock win gold as day three in Tokyo becomes 'Magic Monday' for Team GB.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England will have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate, which workers are exempt and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: A small number of named employees in key sectors will be exempt from some rules

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 46 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Fully jabbed adults don't have to self-isolate after visiting amber-list countries - except France.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The contact tracing app could be changed to make it less sensitive, so it sends fewer alerts.

item.title: Care homes worst hit by Covid â€“ search the data
item.description: Figures from Care Quality Commission lay out the pandemic's 'devastating impact' on care homes in England.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and how will Covid affect them?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics have begun, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid symptoms: Is it a cold or coronavirus?
item.description: With similar symptoms, deciding whether or not you need to get tested for coronavirus can be tricky.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Vaccine experts recommend that a limited group of children should be offered Covid jabs ahead of winter.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.
